alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 17 at 12:48PM PDT until April 18 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT TUESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Tuesday, then from 1 PM Tuesday to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
